name: places/ChIJnc6m4ydawokRxARNgcIR5Z0
formattedAddress: 17 Allen St #7, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 17 Allen St #7, New York, NY 10002, USA

editorialSummary.text: Simple yoga studio with classes blending multiple styles, plus views of the Manhattan Bridge.

originalText.text:
II recently attended Francesco’s morning yoga class, and I must say I thoroughly enjoyed it. Francesco is a great source of energy, and I appreciate how she includes many affirmations during the practice. I'm definitely keen on attending more of her classes.

The studio is small, so expect to be close to others, but despite that, it felt airy and comfortable.

People working in studio were friendly, and everyone was welcoming.

They provide all the necessary equipment for practice, so you won’t need to bring your own mat. However, after the session, they request that you clean the mats. If cleanliness is a concern for you, take this into account. Personally, I found them clean enough not to be bothered.

Finding the studio was a bit challenging. You'll need to locate the next door after the shop and head up to the top floor.

Giraffes in studio are adorable!

originalText.text: Such a special yoga studio, I’m so glad I found it. I’ve been coming here for months because it truly is cozy and unpretentious, yet very challenging and spiritual all at once. This is a heart-felt studio, run by kind people who really care (we miss you Brian, but really everyone here is amazing). They are doing their very best to keep yoga affordable, not a luxury, which is very hard considering NYC rents. My primary reason for starting yoga here was chronic lower back and hip pain which was getting worse. After months of coming I’m happy to say it has gotten much better (read: not cured, but way better).  The instructors here are top notch, spiritual, daoist, and approachable… this is not just another “pretty yoga place” with trendy lululemon vibes, this is the real deal, and I love it!

originalText.text: Such a great place, very calming and cosy. I am very glad to have been taught multiple times by teachers from sky ting. I can say that coming here was not a disappointment, and definitely inspired me to continue with yoga.

text.text: Such a great place, very calming and cosy. I am very glad to have been taught multiple times by teachers from sky ting. I can say that coming here was not a disappointment, and definitely inspired me to continue with yoga.

originalText.text: I'm so grateful that SkyTing is so close to home for me. The studio is beautiful and airy with a great view of the Manhattan Bridge. The instructors are inspiring and their classes are challenging. They encourage you to move in unconventional ways. Mats are complimentary and classes can get pretty packed. Krissy, Chloe, and Kate are a few of my favorite instructors!

originalText.text:
Super cute studio, the main room is filled with natural light and a minimalist decoration, with plants and a big giraffe in the corner :)

I liked the vibe there, and the class was really good. The teacher was knowledgeable, took her time to explain and make the class suitable for all the students.
